verses.roman:
teṅho tomāra sādhya-sādhana karibe niścaya
sākṣāt īśvara teṅho,--nāhika saṁśaya

synonyms: teṅho—He; tomāra—your; sādhya—objective of life; sādhana—process; karibe—will do; niścaya—ascertain; sākṣāt—direct; īśvara—the Lord; teṅho—He is; nāhika—there is no; saṁśaya—doubt.
translation: "Because He is the Lord [īśvara]," the brāhmaṇa told him, "undoubtedly He can give you proper direction."
